unnormalised: Delhi HC: 'Chacha Chaudhary' wins copyright battle! The Delhi High Court, in a landmark (and frankly, hilarious) decision, sided with Diamond Toons in a copyright infringement case against a character suspiciously similar to our beloved Chacha Chaudhary.
normalised: Delhi H-C: 'Chacha Chaudhary' wins copyright battle! The Delhi High Court, in a landmark (and frankly, hilarious) decision, sided with Diamond Toons in a copyright infringement case against a character suspiciously similar to our beloved Chacha Chaudhary.

unnormalised: Apparently, someone thought they could get away with creating a 'Chacha Chaturvedi' – almost the same wisened old dude with a red turban, but with a slightly different surname. The court wasn't buying it. They said, and I quote (approximately), "Come on, yaar! Even Billu would see through this!" They slapped the infringing party with a hefty fine of ₹20 lakhs. Serves 'em right!
normalised: Apparently, someone thought they could get away with creating a 'Chacha Chaturvedi' – almost the same wisened old dude with a red turban, but with a slightly different surname. The court wasn't buying it. They said, and I quote (approximately), "Come on, yaar! Even Billu would see through this!" They slapped the infringing party with a hefty fine of rupee twenty lakhs. Serves 'em right!

unnormalised: Moral of the story? Don't mess with Chacha Chaudhary. His brain works faster than a computer, and apparently, faster than the Indian legal system... sometimes. Next up, I bet Sabu's gonna sue someone for using his likeness to sell protein powder. Stay tuned!
